grammar.treeinsertion

Class ElementaryTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • grammar.treeinsertion.ElementaryTree
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActivatedElementaryTree

    public class ElementaryTree
extends java.lang.Object
    A grammatical rule in the tree insertion grammar. Implicitly describes a tree with nodes of several types. These trees can be combined with two operations adjunction and substitution. Consists of:
    • a list of context-free grammar rules (also production rules) (see Layer)
    • an index
    • a lexicalanchor
    • a TreeType
    • a frequency
    • a certain probability
    Author:
    Fabian Gallenkamp

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected long frequency
      Frequency in which the lexical-anchor occurs in the tree insertion grammar.
      protected long index
      Unique index of this ElementaryTree in the dictionary of the tree insertion grammar.
      protected java.util.List<Layer> layers
      CFG-production-rules describing implicitly the TIG-rule tree.
      protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> lexicalanchor
      A lexical-anchor is an index (one or more words/units), the tree is connected to.
      protected double probability
      Probability in which this ElementaryTree occurs in the tree insertion grammar.
      protected TreeType type
      TreeType of this ElementaryTree, can't be null.
